Package cs4b.proj1.observer

Class EventContainer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs4b.proj1.observer.EventContainer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which the observer accepts. Other types are ignored.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IObserver
    public class EventContainer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IObserver
    This is a stupid observer class which just stores whatever it recieves. Meant mostly for testing, but could be useful elsewhere.

      • eventType

        private java.lang.Class<T> eventType
        This is needed. Because Java. It's dumb. Don't ask any questions.

      • allEvents

        private java.util.LinkedList<T> allEvents
        We are explicitly marking this LinkedList because we use some of its methods. List will NOT work.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventContainer

        public EventContainer​(java.lang.Class<T> eventType)
        Due to limitations of java, when constructing one of these, you MUST pass in the T.class, which is an object of type Class. This is needed so that we can typecast the event we recieve.
        Parameters:
        eventType -

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(java.lang.Object eventInfo)
        Let the observer know that something happened with one of its subjects.
        Specified by:
        update in interface IObserver
        Parameters:
        eventInfo - Whatever the subject decides to share about the event.

      • getEventInfo

        public T getEventInfo()
        Gets the most recent event which the observer recieved.
        Returns:
        The most recent event. Returns null if nothing has been recieved yet.

      • getAllEvents

        public java.util.List<T> getAllEvents()
        Gets the list of all events. Is never null, and cannot be modified.
        Returns:
        All of the events which this observer has recieved.
